name: Benzene

energies.comment: Total bond energy including aromatic stabilization. Benzene has +148 kJ/mol resonance energy making bonds STRONGER than localized cyclohexatriene structure. Measured via hydrogenation experiments: benzene → cyclohexane releases -208 kJ/mol, vs expected -360 kJ/mol for cyclohexatriene, giving 152 kJ/mol aromatic stabilization.
energies.source: Kistiakowsky et al., J. Am. Chem. Soc. 1936, 58:146-153
energies.confidence_note: Well-established experimental value, measured by multiple independent methods since 1936. Uncertainty ~1-2 kJ/mol.

reference_energies.comment: Standard bond energies (kJ/mol) for naive calculation

notes: Benzene exhibits aromatic stabilization (~150 kJ/mol resonance energy)
Bond orders shown as 1.5 to represent delocalized π-system
Naive prediction would use localized single/double bonds
This is THE canonical example of additivity violation in chemistry
